objinfo.medium: pen and ink and water color, varnished
objinfo.pennednumbers: noneButlin 811 reports that the work may be signed "WB" but that this signature is "very obscure." A few small curving lines bottom left may be remnants of these initials.

provenance.name: National Trust, Petworth House
provenance.price: given in lieu of estate taxes
provenance.note: Inherited by Blake's wife Catherine upon his death in 1827; sold by Catherine Blake to Lord Egremont in 1829 for £86.8s.; by inheritance to Lord Leconfield and thence to John Wyndham, later Lord Egremont; given by Wyndham in 1957 to Her Majesty's Treasury in lieu of estate taxes; National Trust, Petworth House, Sussex.

desc.objtitle:
The Characters in Spenser's "Faerie Queene",
Object 1 (Butlin 811)

objnote.p: This work is similar in size and panoramic format to Butlin 653, [*Sir Jeffery Chaucer and the Nine and Twenty Pilgrims on Their Journey to Canterbury*](http://www.blakearchive.org/preview/but653). Although probably executed years later, *The Characters in Spenser's "Faerie Queene"* may have been created as a pendant to the Chaucer design.
